page.title: 17EMPLOYMENT-TEENAGERS.
page.content: Youth unemployment in Greenock is above the national average,about 80%. Many stay on at school hoping to obtain more qualifications. Often academic courses are unsuited to their needs. Schools are trying to introduce more vocational courses for the 16-18 group,e.g.Travel Agency Practice, Introduction to Distribution. Other courses deal with the changing pattern of society with its increased leisure time. Unemployed teenagers also can take part in the Youth Training Scheme run by the Manpower Services Commission. This is aimed at giving teenagers work experience and the opportunity to learn the basic skills of a trade. Many criticise the scheme as a source of cheap labour and for failing to create real jobs.
